Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cmonsalve
Reviews.Content: The best part is that this hotel is its location. Room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: vyelena
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (central, but quiet), about 500 meters walking to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysées. The closest Metro is Ternes , which is only a few blocks away from the hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful and English speaking. The double room wasn't so big, but comfortable and clean, was equipped with the TV with satellite channels, air conditioning, wardrobe, tea and coffee making facilities and free Wi-Fi access. Our room had a balcony and nice and very clean bathroom. Right down the street was a mini-market, and couple of bars, restaurants and brasseries, where you can have breakfast or brunch. The easiest way to get to the hotel is to take Air France shuttle from the airport, which arrives to the Arc de Triomphe. We'll definitely come back to the hotel on our next visit in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: LeitaLuetta
Reviews.Content: Good location easily walkable to the Eiffel tower. We took the Le Cars Air France bus from CDG to their Arc location. It is possible to walk to the hotel but, with luggage, we took a taxi. Taxi was not favorable going the short distance and overcharged. Our son arrived later with a car. Parking was in a nearby public garage. Two days cost 70 euros. Breakfast at the hotel is 13 euros. The room was typically small but clean and comfortable. Very nice staff. There is a quality corner market very close so we were able to have coffee, sandwiches, sweets, yogurt, etc., which helped with the food budget. The hotel has big windows that open and they are very well insulated against the ouside noise. Overall good price, quality and proximity to tourist activities. At the Arc, there is an double-deck bus with the top deck open to the sky. One can get off and back on at any number of tourist stops. There are several restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and close”
Reviews.Author: GinRocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro station and near the Ternes Metro station. There is a small elevator. Beds were very comfortable and hotel was clean. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE, they will charge you twice”
Reviews.Author: Boudicca7
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself is great! We got a beautiful and large family room at 153 Euros online with Best Western.. however, when we reserved they charged our card; we brought this to Best Western's attention and a reply from Michael, the desk clerk, kept assuring us that it was only a hold, even though the credit card company said it was a charge. When we got there he charged us again! Back to the hotel... it is only a couple of blocks from the Champs-Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe and they have a free computer to use in the lobby--but the mouse is frustrating. Go there, but pay cash!!!

Reviews.Title: “Experienced two rooms - single was too smal, isle was grand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Best Western traveler
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are very small, bathroom is a wet room which means you shower is on the wall beside the toilet. The isle room is the best one in the hotel. Spacious, larger full size bathroom. Rooms are very clean. Lift is very small. Two person max. You don't want to be on the third floor or higher in the hotter summer months. They are warm up there. Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: uss12000
Reviews.Content: Warmly greeted by receptionist. We were given one out of two rooms early which was great as we were travelling with our kids. Clean comfortable rooms. Good breakfast variety. nice hotel water in bathrooms.Towels werent changed regularly, size of rooms was small but thats typical of Paris. Lift wasnt working though receptionist apologised for this. Close to supermarkets. The one on the left as you leave the hotel is cheaper and more variety compared to the one on the right. To get to Arc De Triomphe turn left from hotel as its closer. Literally 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality in good location”
Reviews.Author: polkadotj86
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the top (6th) floor. The bathroom was big and clean and had hairdryer in it. The room was big enough for a wardrobe and desk as well as the minibar and safe. The reception staff were nice and spoke english. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from champs elysees and the arc de triomphe and is easily accesible from the metro (Ternes being the closest). Breakfast at the cafes/restaurants/hotel is pretty expensive but there is a cafe on avenue wagam called la croisanterie that sells croissants and pain au chocolat etc for about 1.20 euros. Overall happy with the hotel quality and location!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, medium room size and excellent front desk support”
Reviews.Author: Lailai45
Reviews.Content: Front desk ppl are very helpful and nice. Location is near ternes station on metro line 2 which they didn't mention in the website. You won't regret if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but tolerable”
Reviews.Author: maartenvd
Reviews.Content: This hotel won't be a highlight of your trip to Europe, but if you get a good deal on it, it's worth considering. Nothing was offensive, but a lot of it is pretty blah. Some examples: 80F (26C) in the room on a winter day, thermostat locked to "central control", no way to cool down but to open the window and let in noise. Crappy pillows. Breakfast buffet costs €13 but the coffee (instant from machine), orange juice (watered down Tropicana) and croissants (a la frozen Pillsbury) are junk.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: FBumm
Reviews.Content: Can´t recommend the hotel. The only thing is the location - very central of Paris. The rooms are tiny and the front desk is unfriendly. Also it is not very clean and due to coming and going travellers it is very noisy. Since I was alone I survived but as a couple for a romantic weekend in Paris I think it is a nightmare...

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Josefamoreta
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is really quite ok for a short stay in paris. It is close to many of the attractions and it is a really clean place. Of course since it is not a resort you might not want to spend more than 4 days there. The rates are quite fair for what they offer. I will definitely be coming back there. Parking is on the street, just make sure you put quarters on the meter. Check weekends and holidays I think you do not have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small Rooms, Good rates.”
Reviews.Author: JPE905
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights. Location is very good, 500 meters from Arc de Triompe. It was just a short walk with roller luggage from where the Air France bus route 2 lets you off. My room and the dining room had ants. The single room was small and walls were thin. I would not consider this hotel for my wife and I but servivable for a single buisness traveller on a small budget. Breakfast was decent but for 13 Euro you might consider going to the nearby McDonalds. I paid 85 Euro/ night. Not bad for central Paris and forget near the airport for that money. TV didnt work and would have been usefull to monitor volcanoes in Iceland.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but equally ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Indiantraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: I picked this room due to its closeness to Champs Elysee and affordable rate. Both were true but the room was very small and there was a smell to it. The staff was not very friendly and did not accommodate our requests for early check in by just 1 hour. The TV was very small but that is understandable. if you are looking for a room just to crash at night and intend to be outside during the day this may be a good pick

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3* Hotel 5 mins walk to Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Treacle85
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights through booking.com total cost was 210 euros which i believe is quite good price for that kind of hotel in such good location, twim room was very good size, with large comfortable bathroom. It's quite cozy hotel, but more than enough space to move around. Close to the all atractions in Paris. Ternes tube station 2 mins away. it takes about 20 min to Gare du nord train station for Eurostar. Regarding the walls- there was not too much noise as we only heard the cleaners for 2 mins or so but it wasn't too disturbing. yes the lift can't fit in more than two people or one person and luggage, but we didn't come to Paris to stay in the elavator, so it was not a problem for us at all. overall enjoyed our stay there and would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: Fussy_chick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2009 on the second floor of this hotel facing out onto a lovely small quite street. Guests are issued with a card key which sometimes doesn't work and I had to go back downstairs to reception to get it fixed. This card must be placed in a slot for the electricity (lights, aircon, tv) to work. Also the TV was left on so I got a bit of a shock at loud blaring noise when I entered the room for the first time. Leave the TV in standby so you don't wake any guests if you come home late (I was never woken by a neighbouring guest's TV by the way). Pros: Location: So near the Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysees - perfect for shopping and I arrived just in time for the sales (although Paris is very dear for clothes even in a sale). Staff: The reception staff all have very good english and make a real effort. Room: Second floor. Double bed. Was a solo traveller so was fine for space (could be a bit cramped with 2 people but bear in mind most tourists are out all day). Airconditioning: Great to have it but TAKE NOTE: it cannot be switched on when a guest is out so the room may be warm (too hot) when you return. However within about 15-20 minutes it's back to a nice cool temperature. Bathroom: Was very clean and had a bath which was great to relax in every evening. Had a room facing out onto rue de montenotte not onto rue de Terns. Was nice and quiet most of the time. No noise from this little quiet street but I was very near rue de terns so traffic could be a little loud (see below in cons) Room had a little balcony with double doors opening onto it which was lovely. TV: Large flatscreen, obviously all channels in French but I think CNN was on it too. Fridge: Worked fine and very well stocked. I didn't have anything from it as it was too expensive (for my budget) but very handy to store my cheaper bottles of water, drinks etc. Concierge: From what I could see they allow guests to leave luggage if they have to wait for a flight but check this as some hotels have stopped doing this for security risks. Cons Location: The street is a little hard to find so have a very good map handy. Noise: Unfortunately the walls are paper thin but I only had one night out of 4 where a guest stayed in the room next door. However I could hear him going to the toilet and taking a shower at 1:00 am. I could also hear other noisy guests. It's pot luck really if you are staying at the same time with considerate people or just rude ones! My advice with the paper thin walls is to ask that you be put in a room away from other guests if the hotel doesn't have full occupancy when you are staying there. My first night there a lot of noise came from a pub accross the street which was a Thursday night but was quiet after that (11:00 pm) so I'm guessing it's frequented by people who work nearby and not a loud tourist pub at weekends (Fri/Sat/Sun)? Windows/Double doors: Opened onto a little balcony which could have done with some cleaning but then I had great trouble closing them for the next four days and even though the receptionist came up to look they never fully closed. The only thing wrong was extra noise could come in from Terns street so ask to change rooms if you have a dodgy window/double doors. I am a heavy sleeper. Housekeeping: Come every day but one day left a dirty towel with what looked like hair dye stains. I meant to complain but was so busy I forgot but I wouldn't normally let a hotel away with this. Bathroom: Flooded when I took a shower, annoying as I had to use a towel to mop up every morning. Breakfast: Was 13 Euros, cheaper than a lot of other hotels but I never had it at that price. Lift: Really is tiny but hey it works! Can be awkward with large suitcases though. I hope this review was of some help, I would stay there again, but I would warn them about the noise. I do think that all advantages outweigh the disadvantages.

Reviews.Title: “horrible room”
Reviews.Author: KatherineMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel lift was tiny and barely fit a person in it, let alone a person wiht luggage. The room was tiny and the tiles in the bathroom was falling off. the shower screen wouldnt close properly so water went everywhere when you showed. the airconditioning was broken so you sweat at night. The staff were however friendly and helpful and the location was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: POPPYPETALS
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our three day break in Paris and we have had a great time! The location of the hotel is great, it is literally a five minute walk to the Champs Elysees and the Arch de Triomphe where you can easily connect to other places of interest via tour bus (which is fantastic! it is 24 euros for each adult for two days, it is over two hours long and covers almost all the exciting and vital places to visit in paris such as the Louvre Museum and the eiffel tower. You can hop on and off at any stop all day long until about 9pm and they came every 10/15 mins. Great value for money and a great way to enjoy the sights, you also get a commentary. There was so much to do and we didnt get to see every thing we wanted. We cant wait to go back - we were so pleased with the speedy Eurostar connecton into Gare Du Nord and from there easy connection on the metro approx 30 mins to the hotel. The hotel was nice - the reception staff were always very helpful and friendly. The room had everything we needed including a fridge and air con. It was a good base for us to enjoy everything Paris had to offer............. and to finish...Disneyland is truely magical.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bit difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: edpurs999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a side-street just off a main road near to the Arc de Triomphe. It is a little tricky to find, but near to the Metro at Terns. The hotel is small, the rooms are reasonable with plasma TV and a kettle. Our bathroom was small, but ok, someone tall might have had trouble getting into or out of the bath, which was a little on the small side. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel, getting fresh bread from the market accross the road which was lovely. The market sells all sorts of fresh food, and as a good sign is full of locals. The location of the hotel is good, near to the Arc, and the metro service is good. What I particularly liked was that it was just on the edge of the tourst areas, which means you can mingle with the tourists or the locals as the mood takes you. Champs Elysees is about 5 - 10 minutes walk, if you like that sort of thing. The local cafes are quite expensive for coffee and especially tea (around 4 Euro) so it is great that the hotel provide a kettle. They provide free copies of the Inernational Herald Tribune in the lobby, and the English language station is CNN, plus FREE WIFI INTERNET ACCESS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel(-;”
Reviews.Author: MichaelReszczynski
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean rooms. Perfect location 10 min walk to the Arc de triomphe and then anoder 20-30 min to Eiffel Tower. 15 min walk to the RER station which can take you to the Versailles(RER service C) you hve to change train on Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel Station. You can travel all around Paris by Metro(Underground). So hve nice trip everybody(-;

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: welshmelr
Reviews.Content: Booked via expedia.co.uk and got a good price (about €80 per night. The "walk off the street" price for our room was €300). The room was clean, spacious and even had a balcony -- albeit with a view dominated by a nondescript building across the road. Location is great, a few minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Staff were always courteous and helpful. Free internet at the PC in the lobby and free WIFI, although I couldn't get the WIFI to work on my smartphone. Very glad of the effective and quiet air-con in the room when it was hot outside. Area is pretty quiet at night and heavy curtains prevent almost all light from entering the room. Bed was very comfy and large. Nice Creperie, other restaurants and a bakery nearby. Now the bad bits: Area had more homeless people than in other areas of Paris, but they just keep out of the way, not an issue for us. If you want to sleep beyond 8.30 forget it, cleaners use phones in the hallways to communicate between floors. Sliding door to bathroom was not flush with the wall because of its design. This meant a certain lack of privacy in the bathroom, but on the other hand it did let you watch TV with the door "closed" whilst sat on the throne. So not all bad. The pluses outweight the negatives and we would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Elevator but large bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lajoa
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Paris before at another hotel and from what I've heard others say - this was def. the largest bathroom in a Paris Hotel. The front desk staff was helpful and tried answering our questions as best as they could. Good/strong air conditioner in the room but the only option for guest is either on or off. So I just turned it off mid-way thru the night and the room remained cool. Nice flat TV, desk & chair and decent space to move around the room. Great location a few steps away from Arch de Triumph and Champ Elysee. I did not try the breakfast there so I cannot comment on it. Instead we grabbed inexpensive breakfast with English speaking & friendly staff at Pomme de Pain by walking out the hotel on the right and making a left at the corner (Avenue Ternes). I was really upset that I booked a Twin Room but received a room with 2 twin beds pushed together. Upon calling the front desk what I was told was contradictory first by saying that they had no more twin rooms & later saying that what I was given was a twin room, etc. An employee arrived within minutes and she was going to split the beds but given the set-up of the headboard and the amount of space available in the room I just don't know how she planned to do this. So I told her to forget it and leave it that way. Good thing the friend I was traveling with was a very close friend of mine. The elevator was so TINY that I barely fit with our 2 suitcases. The elevator sign says it fits up to 2 people & up to 300lbs but I don't believe it - too tiny. My friend refused to get on the elevator and walked up/down the 4 floors the entire stay. I'm never one to complain about thin walls and such but the proximity of the rooms are too close so whether thin walls or not I couldn't hear people in the other room but I 2 mornings in a row I was rudely awaken by the non-stop ringing of their room phone. I recommend the champagne tasting cruise with O Chateau but book online or by calling in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tamarka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights and I definitely recommend it. The only disturbing thing are maybe thin walls between rooms, so if you have very load neighbours, you can hear them. Room was big enough (who comes to Paris to stay in room?), bathroom was clean and looks like on hotel's official photos. Breakfast is up to you (not included in price).

Reviews.Title: “A good starting place if you fly into Beavais”
Reviews.Author: ughboot
Reviews.Content: I booked last minute and didn't have the choice of hotels that a more organised traveller would have. Best Western Empire Elysees was, overall, a pleasantly surprising hotel. The staff were friendly, the room was surprisingly large and comfortable with a good size bathroom. I have paid a lot more in Paris for similar sized rooms. It is convenient to the Camps Elysees, the Arc du Triomph, a small supermarket and the metro. It is also very convenient for those travellers who arrive at Beavais and get the bus into town. The drop off point for the bus is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and gets you just far enough away from Porte Maillot to be in a nicer part of town. Having said that, there are are more beautiful areas of Paris to stay, which are less touristy and with much better food - the Marais springs to mind. I also personally prefer boutique hotels which have some individuality. However if, like me, you are stuck for time and arriving from Beavais I would characterise this hotel as a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Brooks
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Best Western Empire Elysees for 2 nights in a triple room in December 2007. The hotel is in a typical Parisian building only minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. It's close to 2 metro stations, and in a nice area with shops, markets, restaurants, which feels a lot more like the real Paris than the Champs Elysees. The room itself had a double bed and single bed, with a small but recently renovated bathroom. We were on the 6th floor. The hotel itself is pretty small and does not have the feel of more modern chain hotels like say Marriott, but it is comfortable and has all you need. We got the triple room for approx. €80 a night excl. breakfast, so it was cheap and the location is excellent. Recommended for anyone looking for nice simple comfortable hotel in central location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: StevenBr
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredible small even for a hotel in Paris, bathroom had a shower that allowed you to stay on the toilet (no shower designated area), the TV was suspended on the ceiling in order to free some more space. No free Internet Connection. The elevator can fit maximum 2 people even if it has a notice that says 3 persons. If you are cardiac I advise you to stay away as it can scare one to death when it stops at the designated floor. The breakfast area is also small. The breakfast was average but without plenty of choice. You can get breakfast to your room for free. However it is very expensive compared to what you can get on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Classof64
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be quite charming. As others have stated, the location is great, about a five block walk to the Arc de Triumpe and Charles de Gaulle Metro station (and only one block from the Ternes Metro station). This was just out of the way enough to excape from the tourists. And the grocery store is on the xext block (in the basement under the clothing store). The other reviews helped me prepare for the small elevator - one person with suitcase per trip. Once you have your luggage put away, you can opt for the circular staircase which winds around the elevator shaft (practice for the circular stairs to the top of the Arc de Triumpe). We had our 16-year old grandson with us and found the triple room to be adequate in size. Contrary to a few of the posts, we found all of the staff to be quite helpful and very nice. We thourougly enjoyed our stay in Paris and the hotel played a part in that. The neighborhood seemed safe. There are a few restaurants in the area. I would suggest passing the Chez Clement about 2 blocks away on Ave de Wagram and eating at the sidewalk cafe Chez Clement at 123 Ave des Champs Elysees (2 blocks east of the Arc de Triumpe). As one other post, the phone in our room never worked, however as requested they did provided a wake-up knock on our door the morning of our depart.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cookie1121
Reviews.Content: Arrived Lunchtime check-in was fast, when i booked the hotel i was told breakfast was included but the receptionist said it was room only, we were on the 5th floor the lift could only take 2 people never seen a lift so small, hotel only supplied cartons of milk for tea or coffee on the arrival day not much use if you wanted a hot drink on the second day, the room was small but clean bathroom was small but clean to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daoly
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently for 3 nites from 23 Oct. 2006. The hotel lift is the tiniest I have been in. The bedroom is clean and adequate in size. Mini bar and coffee making facilities are available. Check-in was fast and easy. Bathroom is clean with a bathtub and large in comparison to the room and lift. Arch de Trompe, Champs Elysees, the underground station are all within walking distance. Taxi fare to and fro the Gare du Nord station costs about 9 to 11 euro. There a few shops and eateries including McDonalds around the corner for food. Though hotel is nice would prefer to stay nearer to Champ Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VitalyM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights and it was surprisingly great experience. For the price (I think the rack was 130 e but we paid less) it was much more than expected. The lobby, elevator and room are very tiny but the bathroom is good size and well appointed. It was pretty warm inside in the middle of the winter. The water pressure was very good. We didn't eat at the hotel, there are tons of great eateries around the corner. The hotel is just few blocks from the Arc de Triumph so the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great, but I suppose you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it's Expedia's oversight or the hotel's, but on the hotel information page within Expedia, it specifically says check-in is at 1pm. After arriving on an overnight flight from the US, we were told by a non-sympathetic desk receptionist the room would be ready at 3pm, and no sooner. Exhausted, we returned at 1pm to ask again. Again we were told we could not check in until 3pm, but for lack of anything better to do, we waited in the lobby. They finally gave us a key at 2pm. One to two hours of check-in time is a huge difference when traveling overnight. Also, the hotel's own website is misleading. The front picture is wrong - it's been changed somehow to make the lobby look bigger. There is no separate "concierge" as the site says; the front desk receptionist functions as this. Also, the "bar and lounge" is a small area within 5 feet of the reception desk that had a small couch and two chairs, and a teeny tiny bar (which we never saw anyone use because who is supposed to be manning this "bar"? - the receptionist?). The whole area is smaller than my living room at home. Also, their website says there is valet parking and there is not; says breakfast is 8 euros when it is 12; says "elevators" when there is one elevator that fits either two people smooshed together or one person with their luggage. Also, I don't know how this hotel classifies itself as a business center - there is not even voicemail in the rooms. The front desk will take a message and deliver a hand-written message to your room - while I received several in this way they failed to give me at least one that I know about. As well, there is no internet connection in the rooms but you can purchase a card that will allow you to use their wireless downstairs. Other little things were annoying - there is no iron or ironing board in the rooms but you can get one from reception -- yourself. You yourslef have to go down and pick up the board and iron, and then yourself bring it back when you were done. We had champagne in our room one evening but they had no ice for us to keep it chilled. Overall, this hotel was nothing special. The room was clean and at least there was air conditioning. Good location.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Empire Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Rue Montenotte | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
